page.title: 03FARMING-A COUSLAND CALENDAR.
page.content: THE YEAR'S WORK AT EASTER COWDEN FARM IS A TEAM EFFORT INVOLVING SIX FAMILY FARMS IN LOTHIAN.THE FATHER,FOUR BROTHERS AND SEVEN WORKERS USE TRACTORS,FORK LIFT TRUCKS INDUSTRIAL LOADERS AND COMBINE HARVESTERS IN A CIRCULAR SYSTEM TO DO ALL THE JOBS,HELPING SPREAD THE HEAVY COST OF MACHINERY. THE FARMER'S CALENDAR IS-JANUARY AND FEBRUARY ARE PLOUGHING MONTHS, AND POTATOES ARE SACKED.CEREALS ARE SOWN IN MARCH AND APRIL AND EARLY POTATOES ARE PLANTED.REPAIRS ARE DONE TO DRAINS AND FENCES AND GENERAL TIDYING UP TAKES PLACE.CROPS ARE SPRAYED FOR DISEASE IN MAY,SILAGE CUTTING CONTINUES IN JUNE,WHILE FODDER RAPE IS SOWN IN JULY.WINTER WHEAT AND BARLEY ARE HARVESTED IN AUGUST,POTATOES IN SEPTEMBER AND OCTOBER,WHEN WINTER WHEAT IS SOWN.PLOUGHING ENDS THE YEAR.
